The origin of suffering [sn12.55:4.10]: Craving is a condition for grasping
Grasping is a condition for continued existence
This entire mass of suffering originates
The cessation of suffering (a causal cha: Concentrate on the drawbacks of things
This entire mass of suffering ceases
The destruction of the great tree (a cau: Cut the tree down at the roots
Dig it up and pull the roots out
Cut the tree apart, cut up the parts, and chop it into splinters
Dry the splinters in the wind and sun
Burn them with fire and reduce them to ashes
Winnow the ashes in a strong wind or float them away down a swift stream
The great tree is cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, obliterated, and unable to arise in the future.
